greeting.title: Welcome
greeting.message: Hello, how can I assist you?

1xx.name: Information
1xx.description: The request is still being processed.

100.name: Continue
100.description: The ongoing request to the server has not been rejected yet. (Used in conjunction with the 'Expect 100-continue' header field.) The client can now proceed with the potentially very large request.

101.name: Switching Protocols
101.description: Used when the server has received a request with the 'Upgrade' header field set and agrees to switch to a different protocol. This status code is used, for example, in the transition from HTTP to WebSocket.

102.name: Processing
102.description: Used to avoid a timeout while the server is processing a time-consuming request. This is an interim response, and a final response must follow on the same connection without any further client request.

103.name: Early Hints
103.description: Used in conjunction with the 'Link' header to allow preloading of resources while the server prepares the final response.

2xx.name: Successful Operation
2xx.description: The request was successful, and the response can be used.

200.name: OK
200.description: The request has been successfully processed, and the request's result is transmitted in the response.

201.name: Created
201.description: The request has been successfully processed. The requested resource was created before sending the response. The 'Location' header field may contain the address of the created resource.

202.name: Accepted
202.description: The request has been accepted but will be executed at a later time. The success of the request cannot be guaranteed.

203.name: Non-Authoritative Information
203.description: The server is acting as a 'Transforming Proxy,' receiving a 200 OK response from the source and responding with a modified version of the source document.

204.name: No Content
204.description: The request has been successfully performed, but the response intentionally contains no data.

205.name: Reset Content
205.description: The request has been successfully performed; the client should reset the document and clear any form inputs.

206.name: Partial Content
206.description: The requested part has been successfully transmitted (used in conjunction with the Content-Range header field).

207.name: Multi-Status
207.description: The server's response contains information about multiple resources that may have different status codes.

208.name: Already Reported
208.description: The members of a WebDAV binding have already been summarized in a previous response to the same binding check-in.

226.name: IM Used
226.description: The server has completed the request, and the instance manipulation status specified in the 'IM' header field of the current request has been applied.

3xx.name: Redirection
3xx.description: The request was successful but requires further action or redirection to be completed.

300.name: Multiple Choices
300.description: The requested resource has multiple choices, each with different locations, and the user or user agent can select one of them.

301.name: Moved Permanently
301.description: The requested resource has been assigned a new permanent URL and any future references to this resource should use one of the returned URLs.

302.name: Found
302.description: The requested resource is temporarily located at a different URL. The client should follow the provided 'Location' header field to retrieve the resource.

303.name: See Other
303.description: The response to the request can be found at a different URL, and the client should retrieve it using a GET request to that URL.

304.name: Not Modified
304.description: The requested resource has not been modified since the last time the client accessed it. The client can use the cached version.

307.name: Temporary Redirect
307.description: The requested resource is temporarily located at a different URL. The client should follow the provided 'Location' header field to retrieve the resource using the same method as the original request.

308.name: Permanent Redirect
308.description: The requested resource has been permanently moved to a different URL. The client should follow the provided 'Location' header field to retrieve the resource using the same method as the original request.

4xx.name: Client Errors
4xx.description: The request contains bad syntax or cannot be fulfilled by the server.

400.name: Bad Request
400.description: The server cannot process the request due to malformed syntax. The client should not repeat the request without modifications.

401.name: Unauthorized
401.description: The request requires user authentication. The client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.

402.name: Payment Required
402.description: Reserved for future use. The original intention was that this code might be used as part of some form of digital cash or micro payment scheme.

403.name: Forbidden
403.description: The server understood the request but refuses to authorize it. The client should not repeat the request without modifications.

404.name: Not Found
404.description: The server cannot find the requested resource. It could be a temporary or permanent condition.

405.name: Method Not Allowed
405.description: The method specified in the request is not allowed for the requested resource.

406.name: Not Acceptable
406.description: The server cannot produce a response matching the list of acceptable values defined in the request's 'Accept' header field.

407.name: Proxy Authentication Required
407.description: The client must authenticate itself with the proxy.

408.name: Request Timeout
408.description: The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait.

409.name: Conflict
409.description: The request could not be completed due to a conflict in the current state of the resource.

410.name: Gone
410.description: The requested resource is no longer available, and no forwarding address is known. It is possible that the resource will become available in the future.

411.name: Length Required
411.description: The server refuses to accept the request without a defined 'Content-Length' header.

412.name: Precondition Failed
412.description: The server does not meet one of the preconditions specified by the client's request headers.

413.name: Payload Too Large
413.description: The server refuses to process the request because the payload is too large.

414.name: URI Too Long
414.description: The server refuses to service the request because the requested URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.

415.name: Unsupported Media Type
415.description: The server refuses to service the request because the payload format is in an unsupported format.

416.name: Range Not Satisfiable
416.description: None of the ranges in the request's 'Range' header field overlap the current extent of the selected resource.

417.name: Expectation Failed
417.description: The expectation given in the request's 'Expect' header field cannot be met by the server.

418.name: I'm a teapot
418.description: This code was defined in 1998 as one of the traditional IETF April Fools' jokes. It is not expected to be implemented or used as a real status code.

421.name: Misdirected Request
421.description: The request was directed at a server that is not able to produce a response.

422.name: Unprocessable Entity
422.description: The server understands the content type of the request entity and the syntax of the request entity is correct but was unable to process the contained instructions.

423.name: Locked
423.description: The source or destination resource of a method is locked.

424.name: Failed Dependency
424.description: The method could not be performed on the resource because the requested action depends on another action and that action failed.

426.name: Upgrade Required
426.description: The server refuses to perform the request using the current protocol but might be willing to do so after the client upgrades to a different protocol.

428.name: Precondition Required
428.description: The origin server requires the request to be conditional.

429.name: Too Many Requests
429.description: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

431.name: Request Header Fields Too Large
431.description: The server is unwilling to process the request because its header fields are too large.

451.name: Unavailable For Legal Reasons
451.description: The server is denying access to the resource as a consequence of a legal demand.

5xx.name: Server Errors
5xx.description: The server failed to fulfill a valid request.

500.name: Internal Server Error
500.description: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

501.name: Not Implemented
501.description: The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.

502.name: Bad Gateway
502.description: The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from an inbound server it accessed while attempting to fulfill the request.

503.name: Service Unavailable
503.description: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or maintenance of the server.

504.name: Gateway Timeout
504.description: The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, did not receive a timely response from an upstream server it accessed while attempting to fulfill the request.

505.name: HTTP Version Not Supported
505.description: The server does not support the HTTP protocol version used in the request.

506.name: Variant Also Negotiates
506.description: The server has an internal configuration error: the chosen variant resource is configured to engage in transparent content negotiation itself and is therefore not a proper end point in the negotiation process.

507.name: Insufficient Storage
507.description: The method could not be performed on the resource because the server is unable to store the representation needed to successfully complete the request.

508.name: Loop Detected
508.description: The server terminated an operation because it encountered an infinite loop while processing a request with 'Depth: infinity'.

510.name: Not Extended
510.description: The policy for accessing the resource has not been met in the request.

511.name: Network Authentication Required
511.description: The client needs to authenticate to gain network access.
